... I assumed ... pmut was connections only and not relevant to pulling - apart from that assumption being stupid (connections not relevant to pulling...) I shouldn't assume in the first place. Btw, if anyone cares, `model.Availability` is the "culprit".

Well thanks a lot @xjtdy888 for discovering and reporting this and sorry @calmh for causing yet another rc.

### Purpose

issue.title: lib/model, lib/weakhash: Abort pulling quicker on folder stop (ref #5028)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

@xjtdy888 originally reported a deadlock when restarting a folder (changing config) while pulling in #5028. Further reports in the [PR fixing that](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/pull/5029) showed that stopping a folder can take a long time due to transmissions in progress. Therefore I am adding abort points at suitable places to speed stopping up. I split `pullerRoutine` up to be able to return early without having to care about the routine cleanup at every return.
